channel.title: Comments on: Unlocking decorators and other ES7 features with Webpack and Babel

item.title: By: Josh H
item.dc:creator: Josh H
item.description:
I wrote a post on how to add ES7 decorators to Babel 6 for those interested. I'd appreciate a backlink if you feel it's worth it:
http://technologyadvice.github.io/es7-decorators-babel6/
item.content:encoded:
I wrote a post on how to add ES7 decorators to Babel 6 for those interested. I’d appreciate a backlink if you feel it’s worth it:

http://technologyadvice.github.io/es7-decorators-babel6/

item.title: By: James K Nelson
item.dc:creator: James K Nelson
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/unlocking-decorators-and-other-es7-features-with-webpack-and-babel/#comment-3823">Richard</a>.
Thanks for leaving this comment - Babel 6's syntax has completely changed. I've added a comment to the top and hope to release a guide for Babel 6 soon.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Richard.

Thanks for leaving this comment – Babel 6’s syntax has completely changed. I’ve added a comment to the top and hope to release a guide for Babel 6 soon.

item.title: By: Richard
item.dc:creator: Richard
item.description: I've tried both the syntax in the article and in the first comment for webpack and I keep getting: Unknown option: base.stage
item.content:encoded: I’ve tried both the syntax in the article and in the first comment for webpack and I keep getting: Unknown option: base.stage

item.title: By: Arnold
item.dc:creator: Arnold
item.description: Thanks for the info. Here is the same but with query string: { test: /\.js$/, loader: 'react-hot!babel?stage=0&optional=runtime',//for Object.assign exclude: /node_modules/ } Maybe it can be useful for someone.
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the info. Here is the same but with query string:
{
test: /\.js$/,
loader: ‘react-hot!babel?stage=0&optional=runtime’,//for Object.assign
exclude: /node_modules/
}
Maybe it can be useful for someone.
